title: Wave properties - loudness vs amplitude and P-eq

content.question:
Three identical machines generate sound waves by increasing and decreasing the air pressure relative to the equilibrium pressure of the surrounding air, as shown in the figure for one of the machines. The graph represents the air pressure directly in front of the machine as a function of time. For reference, the vertical axis indicates the equilibrium pressure <math alttext="P sub eq" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi>eq</mi></msub></math> of the surrounding air, as well as the pressure maximum <math alttext="P sub max" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi>max</mi></msub></math> and minimum <math alttext="P sub min" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi>min</mi></msub></math> of the air as the sound wave passes through it.
The three machines – Machine <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>, Machine <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, and Machine <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math> − are in different locations. The equilibrium pressure <math alttext="P sub eq" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi>eq</mi></msub></math> of the surrounding air, as well as the pressure difference <math alttext="P sub max, end sub, minus P sub eq, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi>max</mi></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mtext>eq</mtext></msub></math>, are indicated in the table for each machine.
Machine<math alttext="P sub eq, end sub, in atmospheres" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mtext>eq</mtext></msub><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>atm</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></math><math alttext="P sub max, end sub, minus P sub eq, end sub, in atmospheres" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mi>max</mi></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mtext>eq</mtext></msub><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>atm</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></math><math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math><math alttext="1.0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.0</mn></math><math alttext="1.0 times 10 raised to the negative sixth power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn></mpadded></msup></math><math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math><math alttext="1.0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.0</mn></math><math alttext="2.0 times 10 raised to the negative sixth power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn></mpadded></msup></math><math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math><math alttext="0.8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.8</mn></math><math alttext="1.0 times 10 raised to the negative sixth power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn></mpadded></msup></math>
Which of the following correctly ranks the loudness <math alttext="L sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></msub></math>, <math alttext="L sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></msub></math>, and <math alttext="L sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></msub></math> of the sound generated by machines <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>, <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math>, respectively?

choices.label: <math alttext="open parenthesis, L sub X, end sub, equals L sub Y, end sub, close parenthesis, is greater than L sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mi>X</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mi>Y</mi></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mi>Z</mi></msub></math>

<math alttext="L sub Y, is greater than, open parenthesis, L sub X, end sub, equals L sub Z, end sub, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mi>Y</mi></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mi>X</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mi>Z</mi></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="L sub Y, is greater than, L sub X, which is greater than, L sub Z, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mi>Y</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mi>X</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mi>Z</mi></msub></math>

<math alttext="L sub Z, is greater than, L sub X, which is greater than, L sub Y, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mi>Z</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mi>X</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mi>Y</mi></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="L sub Y, is greater than, open parenthesis, L sub X, end sub, equals L sub Z, end sub, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mi>Y</mi></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mi>X</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mi>Z</mi></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

topic.text: 14.1: Properties of Wave Pulses and Waves

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
